member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Database.DatabaseConnection
member.summary: Represents a database defined for a label format.
member.remarks:
The BarTender print engine allows several different database types to be defined for label formats. Supported database formats include text file, ODBC, SAPIdoc, or OLE DB format.
The LabelFormat object contains a collection of
DatabaseConnection objects. Multiple databases may be defined for the LabelFormat instance, and are accessed via the LabelFormat's
DatabaseConnections collection.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Database.TextFile.UseFieldNamesFromFirstRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use field names from the first record of a text file.
member.value: A bool. True if field names from the first record of a text file are used; false if otherwise.
member.remarks: The first record (or row) can contain header information for each of the field columns. By setting this property to true, BarTender will read the first record and assign field names based on the values read. All remaining records will be read as data to be printed on the label.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection
member.summary: Represents a system database connection.
member.remarks: In order to access information contained in the BarTender System Database, you must first establish a connection to the database. The SystemDatabaseConnection object represents a connection made to a BarTender System Database. The connection must be made using the Connect method. A connection can be manually configured using the properties contained within the SystemDatabaseConnection class.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the system database connection.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.Connect
member.summary: Connects to the BarTender System Database.
member.remarks: The Connect() method is required when using the System Database SDK, and when connecting to a BarTender System Database. You can connect to the database in one of two ways: either by using the settings configured in BarTender System Database Setup dialog, or by configuring the connection using properties in the SystemDatabaseConnection class. For more information, see the Getting Started page on Connecting to the BarTender System Database.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.Authentication
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication method to use when connecting to the system database.
member.remarks: An authentication method verifies the identity of a user logging into the system database. When using Windows authentication, the username and password for database access is derived from the user currently logged into the computer. When using SQL authentication, a user must supply a separate user name and password unique to the system database.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a SQL Server database.
member.remarks:
ConnectionString returns the connection string that is used to make a connection to the system database. If SystemDatabaseConnection.Method is SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.SystemDatabaseSetup, the connection string returned will be based on the settings configured in the BarTender System Database Setup dialog. If SystemDatabaseConnection.Method is SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.Manual, the connection string returned will be based on the values of the properties in the SystemDatabaseConnection class.
In order to set a value for ConnectionString, SystemDatabaseConnection.Method must be set to SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.ConnectionString; otherwise, the value set for ConnectionString will be ignored.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets the database name of the BarTender System Database. A typical name is "BarTender".
member.remarks: DatabaseName is valid only if Method is set to SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.Manual.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection method to use when connecting to the system database.
member.remarks:
Two authentication modes are available when connecting to the BarTender System Database:
Windows Authentication allows you to connect with a local user account that has the proper read, write, and create database permissions on the remote database.
SQL Authentication allows you to connect with an SQL Server Authentication login name and password which is predefined during the SQL Server install. SQL Server performs the authentication by checking to see if an SQL Server login account has been set up and if the specified password matches the one previously recorded.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when connecting to the system database.
member.remarks: Password is valid only if Method is set to SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.Manual and Authentication is set to SystemDatabaseAuthentication.SQLServer.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.ServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets the server name where the system database is located on the network.
member.remarks: ServerName is valid only if Method is set to SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.Manual.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the user name to use when connecting to the system database.
member.remarks: UserName is valid only if Method is set to SystemDatabaseConnectionMethod.Manual and Authentication is set to SystemDatabaseAuthentication.SQLServer.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection.Version
member.summary: Returns the system database version identifier. Read-only.
member.remarks: Connect() must be called prior to using Version.
member.exception: The current user lacks permission to perform this operation. Check ServerName, Authentication, UserName, or Password for correct values.
Connect() has not been called.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.DateTimeRangeFilter
member.summary: Represents a filter used to query records from the system database based on time range.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.DateTimeRangeFilter.#ctor(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates a filter used to query records from the system database based on time range.
member.remarks: DateTimeRangeFilter supports querying records between a start and end time range using DateTime objects. The end time must be greater than and have the same DateTime.Kind as the start parameter. DateTimeRangeFilter supports finding values for both local and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). To convert to UTC time see DateTime.ToUniversal() for more information.
member.exception: Thrown if the end time is less than the start time.
Thrown if the start and end times do not have the same DateTime.Kind.
member.param: The start time.
The end time. The end time must be greater than and have the same DateTime.Kind as the start parameter.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.DateTimeRangeFilter.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.DateTimeRangeFilter.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the end time.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrinterMonitor
member.summary: Provides delegates and events used to monitor printers.
member.remarks:
When printing a label format via a networked printer, the Printer Maestro service MUST be installed on both the computer the networked printer is attached to and the local machine the client application is running on.
If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on a printer, no printer event monitoring will occur for that printer. If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on the client computer, no printer event monitoring will occur for any printer used by the client computer. In both cases, resulting print jobs will generate an
PrinterMonitorErrorOccurred event.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive a basic event from an instance of PrinterMonitor.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrinterMonitor
member.summary: This interface declares events used to monitor printers.
member.remarks:
To monitor printer events the Printer Maestro service MUST be installed on both the computer the networked printer is attached to and the local machine the client application is running on.
If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on a printer, no printer event monitoring will occur for that printer. If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on the client computer, no printer event monitoring will occur. In both cases, resulting printer events will generate an
PrinterMonitorErrorOccurred event.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType
member.summary:
Specifies the type of image to export in the
ExportPrintPreviewToFile and
ExportImageToFile methods.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.JPEG
member.summary: The image is a Joint Pictures Experts Group, or JPEG, image. This image type is the standard method of compression for photographic images. Has an enumeration value of 0.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.TIFF
member.summary: The image is a Tag Image File format, or TIFF, image. This image type is commonly used to archive images. Has an enumeration value of 1.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.GIF
member.summary: The image is a Graphics Interchange Format, or GIF, image. This image type is an 8-bit per pixel bitmap image format. Has an enumeration value of 2.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.PNG
member.summary: The image is a Portable Network Graphics, or PNG, image. This image type was created by CompuServe® to replace the GIF format. Has an enumeration value of 3.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.PSD
member.summary: The image is a PSD image. This image type is used by the Adobe Photoshop® graphics editor. Has an enumeration value of 4.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.CLP
member.summary: The image is a Microsoft Windows Clipboard image. This image type is used to store the contents of the clipboard to disk. Has an enumeration value of 5.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.CUT
member.summary: The image is a device-independent image. The image is stored in a .CUT file and the palette is stored in a .PAL file. If the image has no .PAL file, it is considered to be a grayscale image. Has an enumeration value of 6.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.ECW
member.summary: The image is an Enhanced Compressed Wavelet image. Has an enumeration value of 7.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.EMF
member.summary: The image is a Enhanced Windows Metafiles image. This image type is a vector file that can contain a raster image. Has an enumeration value of 8.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.EPS
member.summary: The image type is an Encapsulated PostScript image. This image type is the standard format for importing and exporting postscript files. Has an enumeration value of 9.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.EXF
member.summary: This image type is the standard format for image files created using digital cameras and other input devices. Has an enumeration value of 10.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.FLC
member.summary: This image type is an animation file created by AutoDesk (also .fli). Has an enumeration value of 11.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.FPX
member.summary: The image is a FlashPix image. This image type was created by Eastman Kodak Company®, Microsoft Corporation®, Hewlett-Packard Company® and Live Picture Inc (Sonic Solutions®) to make the use of digital color images easier Has an enumeration value of 12.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.IMG
member.summary: This image type contains the raw information dump of the contents of a file or disk. Has an enumeration value of 13.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.IFF
member.summary: The image is an Interchange File Format image. This image type is a general purpose data storage format. Has an enumeration value of 14.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.CMP
member.summary: This image type is a LEAD compressed format for grayscale and color images. LEAD compressed format results in small files with good image quality. Has an enumeration value of 15.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.CIN
member.summary: The image is a Kodak Cinson image. Has an enumeration value of 16.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.AWD
member.summary: The image is a Microsoft Fax file format image. Has an enumeration value of 17.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.MSP
member.summary: The image is a Microsoft Paint file format image. Has an enumeration value of 18.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.PCX
member.summary: The image is a PaintBrush PCX format image. The PaintBtrush PCX format was designed by ZSoft. Has an enumeration value of 19.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.PSP
member.summary: The image is a PaintShopPro image. Has an enumeration value of 20.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.ImageType.PPM

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormatThumbnail
member.summary: Exports thumbnail images of label formats.
member.remarks:
Each label format file contains an embedded thumbnail image. To extract this image, call the static
Create method.
The extracted thumbnail represents a label format prior to printing. This Image will maintain the label format's aspect ratio. If the Image size does not conform to the aspect ratio, the label format portion of the image will scale down to the appropriate size to maintain aspect ratio; a colored background will fill in the remainder of the image.
Note: If the label format file can't be opened, the returned Image will be the BarTender label format icon.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create an image of a format and save it to file.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormatThumbnail.Create(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a thumbnail image using any label format file.
member.param:
The file name of the
LabelFormatDocument to export the thumbnail of.
The background color of the thumbnail image. This parameter does not take into account the alpha channel of a Color.
Defines the width of the exported thumbnail in pixels.
Defines the height of the exported thumbnail in pixels.
member.returns:
An
Image object. The caller is responsible for calling Dispose() on the returned Image object to optimize memory usage.
member.remarks: If the width and height are above the thumbnail's default resolution, the image will automatically scale to that size. Image quality may be reduced if this occurs.
member.exception: An exception is thrown if the format file does not exist.
An exception is thrown if width or height are less than 1 or greater than 4096.

An exception is thrown if an error occurs while exporting the thumbnail. There are several reasons this could happen: 1) The label format file is not a BarTender label format or is corrupt. 2) Access to the label format file is denied. 3) BarTender may need to be reinstalled.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create an image of a format and save it to file.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormatThumbnail.GetComment(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts the comment from the LabelFormatFile
member.param:
The file name of the
LabelFormatDocument to extract the comment of.
member.returns: The label comment
member.remarks: Since this method does not require BarTender to be running, it is much faster than getting the comment from a LabelFormatDocument object.
member.exception: An exception is thrown if the format file does not exist.

An exception is thrown if an error occurs while extracting the comment. There are several reasons this could happen: 1) The label format file is not a BarTender label format or is corrupt. 2) Access to the label format file is denied. 3) BarTender may need to be reinstalled.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection
member.summary: Provides settings used to connect to a Seagull License Server.
member.remarks:
The
LicenseServer object provides two LicenseConnections,
PreferredConnection and
AlternateConnection. Ensure these are set correctly to connect to a Seagull License Server.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to change the port of a LicenseConnection instance.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection.Release
member.summary: Releases all COM pointers. Should only be used when the Bt Application is about to be quit.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection.Address
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the preferred Seagull License Server.
member.value:
A string. Specifies the IP address or name of the computer that the Seagull License Server is running on. The address can be a server name, a domain name, or an IP Address.
Setting the value to "*" allows automatic detection of the Seagull License Server. A port value must then be specified. BarTender will use this port to find a computer on the local network that is running Seagull License Server.
Note: Automatic detection will not find a Seagull License Server that is behind a network router.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port used to communicate with the Seagull License Server.
member.value: An int. May be any valid value between 1024 to 65535.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of time in seconds that BarTender will keep trying to communicate with the Seagull License Server before giving up.
member.value: An int. The value is represented in seconds.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LicenseConnection.Retries
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times BarTender will attempt to connect to a Seagull License Server.
member.value: An int. Specifies the number of times BarTender will attempt to connect to a Seagull License Server.

To turn on printer caching, set either
AllowFormatCaching or
AllowGraphicsCaching to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to interactively prompt for data input at print-time.
member.value: A bool. True if an interactive prompt for data is to appear at print-time; false if otherwise.
member.remarks:
True interactively prompts for data input at print-time; false if otherwise. The names and values of print-time prompt dialogs can be accessed through a LabelFormat's
Prompts collection.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.IdenticalCopiesOfLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of identical label copies to print.
member.value: An int. Represents the number of identical label copies to print.
member.remarks: The IdenticalCopiesOfLabel specifies the number of copies to print of each label or, when serializing labels, the number of copies of each label in a sequence.
member.exception: An ArgumentException is thrown if IdenticalCopiesOfLabel is set to a value that is less than 1.
An InvalidOperationException is thrown if the format doesn't support the number of identical copies. See SupportsIdenticalCopies
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to set the number of identical copies to print.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the print job.
member.value: A string. Represents the name of the print job.
member.remark: JobName can be any length but only the first 31 characters will display in a print job listing in the printer's print queue window. If JobName is set to an empty string, the label format name is used.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the print job is logged to the BarTender log file.
member.value: A bool. True if the print job is logged to the BarTender log file; false if otherwise.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.PrinterName
member.summary: Gets or sets the printer to which the label format is currently assigned.
member.value: A string. Represents the printer to which the label format is currently assigned.
member.remarks: The Documents.Open method may also be used to assign a printer to a label format.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.PrintToFileLicense
member.summary: Gets or sets the license used to print the format to file.
member.value: A string. Contains the license used to print the format to file.
member.exception: A LicenseException is thrown if the BarTender version is not EnterpriseAutomationEdition or greater.

remarks.para: The PrintToFileLicense property requires EnterpriseAutomationEdition.

If the PrintToFile property set to true, PrintToFileLicense must be set to a valid license key. This is obtained by calling the Printer.CreatePrintToFileLicense method found in the BarTender Print Client assembly.

When printing to file using the BarTender print engine, the resulting output is an encrypted print file. This file can only be printed using the Printers.SendPrintCode method, also located in the BarTender Print Client assembly.

The print license key expires after ten minutes. It should therefore be requested each time the format is printed to file. The printer file can only be printed from the computer that originally requested the license; it must also use the printer that the license was requested for.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.LabelObjectPrintMethod
member.summary: Gets a reference to the LabelObjectPrintMethod object. Read-only.
member.value: A LabelObjectPrintMethod object. The LabelObjectPrintMethod object controls how LabelObjects are printed.
member.remarks: The LabelObjectPrintMethod property returns a reference to the format's LabelObjectPrintMethod object.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.PrintToFile
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the label format will be printed to file.

remarks.para: If set to true, PrintToFileLicense must be set to a valid license key. This is obtained by calling the Printer.CreatePrintToFileLicense method found in the BarTender Print Client assembly.

When printing to file using the BarTender print engine, the resulting output is an encrypted print file. This file can only be printed using the Printers.SendPrintCode method, also located in the BarTender Print Client assembly.

The print license key expires after ten minutes. It should therefore be requested each time the format is printed to file. The printer file can only be printed from the computer that originally requested the license; it must also use the printer for which the license was requested.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to print to file.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.RecordRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that specifies the range of records that will be printed.
member.value: A string. Specifies the range of records that will be printed.
member.remarks: Use the RecordRange property to specify a set of records for printing. Individual records are specified by number and separated by commas (i.e. "1,3,5"). A range of numbers indicated with a hyphen is used to specify a series of consecutive records (i.e. "3-8"). Parentheses can be used to specify the number of copies to be printer for each record (e.g. 3(5) will print five copies of the third record).
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to set the range of records to be printed.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintSetup.ReloadTextDatabaseFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to reload text databases just before the job prints.
member.value: A bool. True reloads the databases just before the job prints; false if otherwise.
member.remarks: This property refreshes databases, defined in the Databases collection.

member.value: A bool. True if the user will be prompted at print-time to select which records will be printed; false if otherwise.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.Task.Engine
member.summary:
Gets the Engine that provides the
Task BarTender print engine functionality.
member.value: An Engine. Contains a reference to a valid BarTender Print SDK Engine.
member.remarks:
Once the Task is assigned to a
TaskEngine, the Engine property will return a valid Engine reference. Custom tasks should utilize this property in order to access BarTender print engine functionality.
All Print SDK Engine functionality is accessible through this property. To ensure best performance, do not attempt to start or stop this Engine reference.
Note: For more information, consult the BarTender Print SDK reference documentation.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.Task.TreatErrorMessagesAsFailure
member.summary: Treat error messages as a task failure.
member.value: A bool. True if the Task will take on the Status of Error if a Message is added to the Messages collection that has a MessageSeverity of Error.
member.remarks: A task returns a TaskStatus upon completion. If TreatErrorMessagesAsFailure is true, then a task will return TaskStatus.Error if a returned Message in the Messages collection has a MessageSeverity of Error. TreatErrorMessagesAsFailure defaults to True.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PageSetup.StockType
member.summary: Gets the name of the stock type. Read-only.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PageSetup.Tray
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the paper tray the label will print from.
member.value: A string. Represents the name of the paper tray the page will print from.
member.remarks: If the selected printer does not accept the text string, an exception will be thrown. The string "Use Printer Settings" is always accepted. Consult your printer documentation for a list of available paper tray options.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PageSetup.Valid
member.summary: Gets whether the PageSetup has any inconsistencies. Read-only.
member.value: A bool. A value of true if there are no inconsistencies with other PageSetup properties; false if inconsistencies exist.
member.remarks: Use this property to determine if a page is valid to print or not. If an inconsistency exists (i.e. the label width is larger than the paper width), the value of this property will be false.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PageSetup.Units
member.summary: Gets or sets the units of measure for any properties that use units. The default value is Units.Current.
member.value: A Units enumeration.

remarks.para: Specify the Units property prior to reading or setting any size-based PageSetup properties. Doing so will ensure the value is in the correct unit of measurement.
This property is not saved in the label format file.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to set the Units to use during page setup.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask
member.summary:
Represents a
Task that prints a label format.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to instantiate and execute a PrintLabelFormatTask in order to print labels.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor
member.summary: This interface declares events used to monitor print jobs.
member.remarks:
When printing a label format via a networked printer, the Printer Maestro service MUST be installed on both the computer the networked printer is attached to and the local machine the client application is running on.
If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on a printer, no print job event monitoring will occur for print jobs on that printer. If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on the client computer, no print job event monitoring will occur for any print job sent from the client computer. In both cases, resulting print jobs will generate an
PrinterMonitorErrorOccurred event.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive a basic event from an object implementing IPrintJobMonitor.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.PrintJobCounter
member.summary: Gets the number of print jobs that are currently printing or in a printer's queue.
member.value: An int. Represents the number of print jobs that are currently printing or in a printer's queue.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobCancelled
member.summary: Occurs when a print job is cancelled.
member.remarks: When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobCancelled event occurs when the print job in the spooler is cancelled.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobCancelled event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobErrorOccurred
member.summary: Occurs when a print job encounters an error.
member.remarks: When any label is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobErrorOccurred event occurs when the print job in the spooler encounters an error.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobErrorOccurred event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobPaused
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has paused.
member.remarks: When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobPaused event occurs when the print job in the spooler has paused.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobPaused event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobResumed
member.summary: Occurs when a print job resumes printing after being paused.
member.remarks: When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobResumed occurs when the print job in the spooler has resumed.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobResumed event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobRestarted
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has restarted.
member.remarks: When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobRestarted event occurs when the print job in the spooler has restarted.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobRestarted event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobSent
member.summary: Occurs when the print job has been sent to the printer port. Depending on the driver settings this event may indicate that the print job has either been sent to the printer or the print job has completed.
member.remarks:
When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobSent event occurs when the print job in the spooler has been sent.
If job verification is enabled, the PrintJobEventArgs used by this event can be cast to JobSentEventArgs to verify that printing has completed. If job verification is not enabled, this event will occur when the printjob has been sent to the printer. In this case, the event does not ensure that the print job has been printed.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobSent event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobQueued
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has been spooled.
member.remarks: When any label format is printed, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The OnJobSpooledEvent occurs when the print job has been spooled and placed on the printer queue.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobQueued event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.IPrintJobMonitor.JobMonitorErrorOccurred
member.summary: Occurs when an error is encountered while monitoring print jobs.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobMonitorErrorOccurred event.

member.summary:
Executes when the
PrintLabelFormatTask leaves the
TaskQueue and is assigned to a
TaskEngine.
member.returns: A bool. If true indicates the Task completed successfully; false if otherwise.
member.remarks:
When inheriting from
PrintLabelFormatTask, place any custom code in this method. This method will be called once the Task leaves the TaskQueue.

member.summary:
Executes when the
PrintLabelFormatTask is added to the
TaskQueue.
member.exception: A TaskException is thrown if validation fails.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.DeletePrintFileAfterPrint
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to delete the print file generated after printing. This property applies if the label format is printed to file by setting Format.PrintSetup.PrintToFile to true. Following printing the print code is copied to the PrintCode property and the print code file is deleted. Setting DeletePrintFileAfterPrint to false avoids deleting the print code file allowing the file to be used for other applications. The print code file name is returned using Format.PrintSetup.PrintToFileName. By default DeletePrintFileAfterPrint is set to true.
member.value: A bool

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.LabelFormat
member.summary: Gets the LabelFormat that is to print.
member.value: A LabelFormat object.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.PrintCode
member.summary: Gets the printer code that is created when a label format is printed to file. Read-only.
member.value: A string. Contains the printer code that is created when a label format is printed to file. The printer code is encrypted and in base-64 format.
member.remarks:
This property is only valid if Format.PrintSetup.PrintToFile is set to true, and Format.PrintSetup.PrintToFileLicense is set to a valid license. If these conditions are not met, the property will return an empty string.
Note: When printing to file using the BarTender print engine, the resulting output is an encrypted print file. This file can only be printed using the Printers.SendPrintCode method, located in the BarTender Print Client assembly.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.PrintTimeout
member.summary:
Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds the
PrintLabelFormatTask will wait for a job to complete printing. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite. If set to 0, the Task will complete after spooling the print job to the printer rather than waiting for the print to complete.
member.value:
An int. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite. If set to 0, the Task will complete after spooling the print job to the printer rather than waiting for the print to complete. The default value is 0 specifying not to wait.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.PrintJobName
member.summary: Gets or sets the print job name that will be used for printing.
member.value: A string. The print job name that will be used for printing.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.PrintResult
member.summary: Gets the result of the print job. This property is only valid after the Task has completed.
member.value: A Result enumeration. The result of the print job.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.SaveAfterPrint
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether or not the
PrintLabelFormatTask will save the format after printing.
member.value: A bool. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
Set SaveAfterPrint to true to retain serialization information when the option to update the serialized substring after print is set.
Note: For this option to be guaranteed to work, only one TaskEngine must be running. If two different TaskEngines print and save the same format simutaneously, serialization might not operate as expected when updating the substring after print.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.PrintLabelFormatTask.SaveAfterPrintCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets when the save the format after printing.
member.value: A SaveAfterPrintConditions enumeration. The default value is SaveAfterPrintConditions.Always.
member.remarks: SaveAfterPrintCondition is only used if the SaveAfterPrint property is set to true.

To open a label format, use the appropriate

To save all open label formats, call the

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Cache
member.summary: Controls the flushing of the printer's memory cache and sets the frequency of automatic flushing.
member.remarks:
When used with the BarTender Print SDK, printer drivers from Seagull Scientific, Inc. have the ability to cache formats and graphics in a printer and reuse them during subsequent print jobs. This can significantly increase the speed of print jobs.
To turn on printer caching, set either
AllowFormatCaching or
AllowGraphicsCaching to true.
In certain situations, such as when a print job has failed or a printer has been replaced, the printer cache is no longer assured to be valid. This can cause the BarTender print engine to execute a print job and fail to send certain items to the printer. In this case, labels may be printed blank or with missing objects. To avoid this, periodically call the
Flush method or set the
FlushInterval property to automatically flush the printer's cache.
Note: Caching does not perform well when more than one computer is printing to the same printer. Ensure in this situation that the
AllowFormatCaching
and
AllowGraphicsCaching properties are set to false.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to flush a cached label format from a printer cache.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Cache.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the printer's memory cache.
member.remarks:
In certain situations, such as when a print job has failed or a printer has been replaced, the printer cache is no longer assured to be valid. In this situation, the BarTender print engine expects the cache to contain certain items. It may not send these items to the printer when it executes a print job, and labels may be printed blank or with missing objects. To avoid this, periodically call the Flush method or set the
FlushInterval property to automatically flush the printer's cache.
To turn on printer caching, set either
AllowFormatCaching or
AllowGraphicsCaching to true.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to flush a cached label format from a printer cache.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Cache.Release
member.summary: Releases all COM pointers. Should only be used when the Format is closed or Bt Application is about to be quit.

member.name: P:Seagull.BarTender.Print.Cache.FlushInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency with which the printer's memory cache is automatically flushed.
member.value: A CacheFlushInterval enumeration. Represents the frequency with which the printer's memory cache is automatically flushed.
member.remarks:
In certain situations, such as when a print job has failed or a printer has been replaced, the printer cache is no longer assured to be valid. In this situation, the BarTender print engine expects the cache to contain certain items. It may not send these items to the printer when it executes a print job, and labels may be printed blank or with missing objects. To avoid this, periodically call the
Flush method or set the FlushInterval property to automatically flush the printer's cache.
To turn on printer caching, set either
AllowFormatCaching or
AllowGraphicsCaching to true.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue
member.summary:
Contains a collection of
Task instances that are awaiting execution by an available
TaskEngine.
member.remarks:
The TaskQueue collection operates like a queue; Task instances are inserted into the queue and handled in order.
Besides its normal running state, the TaskQueue can be in two other states: locked and paused. These two states are not exclusive to each other; a queue may be locked and paused at the same time.
If a TaskQueue is locked, the TaskQueue is no longer able to recieve a new Task instance. The TaskQueue is locked by calling its
Lock method. To unlock the queue, invoke the queue's
Unlock method.
If a TaskQueue is paused, the TaskQueue still allows Task instances to be added. However, while paused the TaskQueue will cease to process any Task remaining in the queue. To pause a TaskQueue, call its
Pause method. The TaskQueue is unpaused by calling its
Resume method.
member.example: The following example demonstrates basic operations with a TaskQueue object.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.Clear
member.summary:
Removes all
Task instances from the
TaskQueue collection.
member.remarks:
This method does not process the Task instances that are in the queue. Instead, the Clear method forces each Task to return.
The Clear method only affects Task remaining in the queue; it does not affect Task that are currently processing. Any Task that has been cleared from the queue will generate a
TaskStatus.Error. Any Task cleared from the queue will also generate a
Note: The TaskQueue is paused and locked while this operation is being performed.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to clear a TaskQueue instance of all pending tasks.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.Resume
member.summary:
Resumes the
TaskQueue collection.
member.remarks:
When the Resume method is called, Task instances in the queue will resume processing.
To pause the TaskQueue, call the queue's
Pause method.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to resume a TaskQueue after it has been paused.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.Pause
member.summary:
Pauses the
TaskQueue collection. Prevents tasks in the task queue from being processed by a print engine. New tasks can be added to the task queue when paused, but no tasks will process until the queue is resumed. Note: The Pause method does not shut down any running print engines. Refer to the TaskManager's
Stop method, and the TaskEngine's
Stop and
Terminate methods for information on shutting down print engines.
member.remarks:
While the TaskQueue is paused, any
Task instances waiting in the queue will not be processed. However, new Task instances are allowed to be added to the queue. Any Task that is currently processing will continue processing as normal.
To resume the queue, call the queue's
Resume method.
Note: This method does not shut down active
TaskEngine instances. Refer to TaskEngine's
Stop and
Terminate methods for information on how to shut down a TaskEngine.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to pause a TaskQueue.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.Lock
member.summary:
Locks the
TaskQueue, preventing new
Task instances from being added to the queue.
member.remarks:
Use the
Unlock method to unlock the TaskQueue.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to lock a TaskQueue, causing exceptions during future attempts to add tasks.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.Unlock
member.summary:
Unocks a locked
TaskQueue, allowing new
Task instances to be added to the queue.
member.remarks:
Use the
Lock method to lock the TaskQueue.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to unlock a TaskQueue after it has been locked.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.QueueTask(Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.Task)
member.summary:
Places a
Task on the
TaskQueue, to be processed in turn by the next available
TaskEngine.
member.param: The Task to be placed on the queue.
member.returns:
A
TaskStatus enumeration. Indicates whether the Task succeeded, encountered an error, timed out, or was submitted.
member.exception:
A TaskQueueException is thrown if the TaskQueue is locked.
A TaskQueueException is thrown if the TaskQueue is full.
A PrintEngineException is thrown if there are no TaskEngine instances currently running.
member.remarks:
QueueTask returns immediately regardless of whether or not the task has been completed. To ensure that the method does not return until the Task has completed, call the
QueueTaskAndWait method.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to perform a task asynchronously using QueueTask.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskQueue.QueueTaskAndWait(Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.Task,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Submits a
Task to the
TaskQueue and waits for the Task to finish processing before returning.
member.param: The Task to submit.

The length of time (in milliseconds) that the QueueTaskAndWait method will wait for a Task to complete processing. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.
Note: The timeout does not take into account time spent on the TaskQueue.
member.returns:
A
TaskStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method will only return once the Task has finished processing.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to perform a task synchronously using QueueTaskAndWait.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks allowed in the queue.

member.remarks:
If the maximum number of tasks is exceeded, a
TaskQueueException is thrown.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager
member.summary:
The TaskManager controls the Collection of
TaskEngines and the
TaskQueue for the SDK.
member.remarks:
The TaskManager controls each TaskEngine that is part of its TaskEngines collection. This includes methods to start, stop, and restart all included TaskEngine instances.
The TaskManager also contains a
TaskQueue. The TaskQueue contains any
Task that is awaiting execution. TaskManager controls the TaskQueue and assigns an available TaskEngine as a Task reaches the head of the TaskQueue.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to implement a class wrapping an instance of TaskManager. This class demonstrates intelligent, thread-safe management of the number of TaskEngines instances within a TaskManager object. The engines are started only as needed, and are stopped after an idle timeout. The class can be used to perform asynchronous printing.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a new instance of a
TaskManager
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create an instance of the TaskManager class.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.Restart(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Stops all
TaskEngine instances that are part of a
TaskEngines collection and starts them again.
member.param:
The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) an attempt will be made to successfully restart a TaskEngine. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.
A value of true if a TaskEngine is to be forcefully terminated and restarted if the TaskEngine cannot be stopped within the timeout period; a value of false if otherwise.
member.exception:
A PrintEngineException is thrown if a
TaskEngine fails to start.
member.remarks:
This method is essentialy the same as calling a TaskManager's
Stop method, followed by a call to the TaskManager's
Start method.
Use this method to restart all TaskEngine instances. By passing a large timeout value,
Tasks may be allowed enough time to finish processing. If a Task must finish processing before a TaskEngine is to restart, specify false as the forceTerminate parameter.
If a TaskEngine has failed to restart, it will have a
TaskStatus of Failed until timeout is reached.
member.returns: A Result enumeration. Indicates whether the underlying BarTender print engine successfully stopped, failed to stop, or timed out.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to restart a TaskEngines instance.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.Start(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Starts a specified number of
TaskEngine instances.
member.param: The number of TaskEngine instances to start.
member.remarks:
At least one TaskEngine must be started prior to submitting
Task instances to the
TaskQueue.
If Start has already been called, this method will return immediately.
If a call to this method is made that attempts to change the number of TaskEngines, an exception is thrown. If more TaskEngine instances are needed, use the
Resize method instead.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to start a TaskEngines instance.

members.member:

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Resizes the number of running
TaskEngine instances to the requested size.
member.param: The number of TaskEngine instances to run.

The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) an attempt will be made to successfully stop a TaskEngine. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.
Note: This parameter only affects a call that results in fewer available TaskEngine instances.

If true, forces a busy TaskEngine to terminate regardless of whether or not the processing
Task is completed; false if otherwise.
member.returns: A Result enumeration. Specifies the result of this method call.
member.remarks: Forcing the termination of any TaskEngine that is currently processing a Task may result in data corruption. Take precaution when this is the case, i.e. during a file save operation.
member.example: The following example demonstrates changing the number of engines running in a TaskManager instance.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.Stop(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Stops all
TaskEngine instances.
If the TaskEngines are already stopped, this method will return immediately.
member.param:
The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) an attempt will be made to successfully stop all TaskEngines. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.

If true, forces a busy TaskEngine to terminate regardless of whether or not the processing
Task is completed; false if otherwise. This only occurs once the timeout limit has been reached.
member.returns: A Result enumeration. Specifies the result of this method call.
member.remarks:
The Stop method will stop any active TaskEngine instance and its underlying BarTender print engine background process. This method must be called to ensure disposal of any background BarTender process the application started.
Once this method is called, the
TaskQueue will lock and no other Task instances are allowed to be sumbmitted to the queue.
If the TaskQueue is not paused, the Stop method will wait until all Tasks on the TaskQueue have had a chance to run as long as the timeout has not been reached. If the TaskQueue is paused, the stop method will wait until all Engines are idle before stopping them, but Tasks on the TaskQueue will remain Queued. To ensure all Tasks are run before the TaskManager is stopped, make sure the TaskQueue is not paused.
By specifying the forceTerminate parameter, an attempt can be made to forcefully shut down any TaskEngine that is still busy processing a Task if the timeout is reached. The Stop method does not guarantee immediate termination of a TaskEngine's background BarTender process. To ensure immediate termination of this process, use the
Terminate method instead.
Note: Forcing the termination of any TaskEngine that is currently processing a Task may result in data corruption. Take precaution when this is the case, i.e. during a file save operation.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to stop all engines in a TaskEngines instance.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskManager.Terminate
member.summary:
Immediately stops all
TaskEngine instances.
Note: All tasks that are pending or currently processing are terminated whether they have completed or not.
If the TaskEngines are already stopped, this method will return immediately.
member.remarks:
All
Task instances that are pending or currently processing are immediately aborted. When running a critical Task (such as a file save operation), this carries a high risk of data corruption. In these cases, use the
Stop method instead.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to terminate all engines in a TaskEngines instance.

member.summary:
Aborts the specified
Task.
member.param: The Task to be aborted.
member.remarks: If the specified task is still pending, it is removed from the TaskQueue. If the task is currently executing, task execution is aborted.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to abort a task after placing it on the queue.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.XMLScriptTask.JobSent
member.summary: Occurs when the print job has been sent to the printer port. Depending on the driver settings this event may indicate that the print job has either been sent to the printer or the print job has completed.
member.remarks:
When the XMLScriptTask prints, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobSent event occurs when the print job in the spooler has been sent.
If job verification is enabled, the PrintJobEventArgs used by this event can be cast to JobSentEventArgs to verify that printing has completed. If job verification is not enabled, this event will occur when the printjob has been sent to the printer. In this case, the event does not ensure that the print job has been printed.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobSent event.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader
member.summary: A reader instance that allows querying the system database.
member.remarks: The SystemDatabaseReader object provides functionality to search and retrieve information from the system database using one of several Get methods. Each Get method returns a collection of job or message objects.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.#ctor(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseConnection)
member.summary: Constructs an instance of the system database reader.
member.param: An instance of a system database connection object.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetBarTenderPrintJobs(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of BarTender print jobs found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
Each time you print a label from an application in the BarTender Suite, BarTender sends the label format to the printer in the form of a BarTender print job. The system database stores detailed information about each print job, such as the time the print job was executed, the status of the print job, and the printer. The GetBarTenderPrintJobs method returns BarTender print jobs found in the BarTender System Database.
GetBarTenderPrintJobs makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of BarTender print job objects. To return all BarTender print jobs, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of print jobs, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific BarTender print job. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetBarTenderPrintJobs() supports the use of the DateTimeRangeFilter, GuidFilter, JobNameFilter, PrinterNameFilter, and UserNameFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of BarTender print jobs.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetBarTenderPrintJobStatusMessages(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of BarTender print job status messages found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
A status message contains information about the status of the print job, such as queued, paused, or error.
The GetBarTenderPrintJobStatusMessages method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of BarTender status messages. To return all BarTender status messages in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of status messages, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific BarTender status message. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetBarTenderPrintJobStatusMessages() supports the use of the DateTimeRangeFilter, GuidFilter, and JobNameFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of BarTender print job status messages.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetBarTenderPrintJobApplicationMessages(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of BarTender print job appplication messages found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
A print job application message is a message returned by an application in the BarTender Suite that is directly related to a print job. An example would be "The print job completed successfully."
The GetBarTenderPrintJobApplicationMessages method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of BarTender messages that relate to a print job. To return all BarTender print job application messages in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of print jobs, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only application messages about a specific BarTender print job. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetBarTenderPrintJobApplicationMessages() supports the use of the ComputerNameFilter, ComputerDomainFilter, DateTimeRangeFilter, GuidFilter, JobNameFilter, and SeverityFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of BarTender print job application messages.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetApplicationMessages(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of appplication messages found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
An application message is a message generated by an application in the BarTender Suite as it processes a print job. BarTender can return messages of three different severities:
Error messages prevent applications in the BarTender Suite from executing a print job. Error conditions must be resolved before you can continue to print or export a label format to a printer code template.
Warning messages notify the user that the print output may not be as expected. It is not mandatory to resolve warnings before printing or exporting a label format.
Informational messages notify the user of an event that will not affect the print output.
The GetApplicationMessages method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of messages generated by applications in the BarTender Suite. To return all BarTender application messages in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of application messages, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only application messages with a specific severity or on a specific computer. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetApplicationMessages() supports the use of the ComputerNameFilter, ComputerDomainFilter, DateTimeRangeFilter, and SeverityFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of application messages.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetPrinterMaestroPrintJobs(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of Printer Maestro print jobs found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
Each time you print a document while Printer Maestro is running, the system database stores detailed information about each print job, such as the time the print job was executed, the status of the print job, and the printer.
The GetPrinterMaestroPrintJobs method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of print job objects. To return all print jobs in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of print jobs, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific print job. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetPrinterMaestroPrintJobs() supports the use of the DateTimeRangeFilter, GuidFilter, JobNameFilter, PrinterNameFilter, and UserNameFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of Printer Maestro print jobs.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetPrinterMaestroJobEventMessages(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of Printer Maestro job event messages found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
An event message is a message that records what happens during a print job. The GetPrinterMaestroJobEventMessages method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of event message objects. To return all job event messages in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of print jobs, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific event message. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetPrinterMaestroJobEventMessages() supports the use of the DateTimeRangeFilter, PrinterNameFilter, and SeverityFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of Printer Maestro job event messages.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetPrinterMaestroInventoryMessages(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of Printer Maestro inventory messages found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
An inventory message is a message generated by Printer Maestro about an inventory item, sometimes alerting the user of supply levels for your printer. The GetPrinterMaestroInventoryMessages method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of inventory event objects. To return all inventory messages in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of inventory items, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific inventory item tracked by Printer Maestro. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetPrinterMaestroInventoryMessages() supports the use of the DateTimeRangeFilter, InventoryItemDescriptionFilter, SeverityFilter, and UserNameFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of Printer Maestro inventory messages.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseReader.GetSecurityPermissionChecks(Seagull.BarTender.SystemDatabase.SystemDatabaseFilter)
member.summary: Returns a collection of security permission checks found in the system database based on a filter.
member.remarks:
When security has been enabled for a PC via Security Center, all applications in the BarTender Suite will check whether the current user has permission to perform certain actions (e.g. Administer, Modify Database Setup, Print in BarTender). The GetSecurityPermissionChecks method a collection of these permission checks found in the BarTender System Database.
The GetSecurityPermissionChecks method makes a query into the System Database and returns a collection of permission checks performed by applications in the BarTender Suite. To return all permission checks stored in the System Database, you can pass in null as the filter. If the BarTender System Database contains a large number of permission checks, this query may take a significant amount of time to run and consume computer memory resources.
It is often necessary to return only information about a specific permission check. The System Database SDK returns specific data through the use of filters. GetSecurityPermissionChecks() supports the use of the ComputerNameFilter, ComputerDomainNameFilter, DateTimeRangeFilter, SecurityPermissionCheckActionFilter, SecurityPermissionCheckResult, and UserNameFilter filters. Passing any other filters will generate a SystemDatabaseFilterException.
member.exception: A SystemDatabaseConnectionException is thrown if a connection cannot be made to the BarTender System Database.
A SystemDatabaseFilterException is thrown if a filter cannot be performed.
member.returns: A collection of security permission checks.

member.summary: Represents a filter used to query records from the system database based on a permission check performed by Security Center.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.Tasks.ExportPrintPreviewToFileTask
member.summary:
Represents a
Task that exports a print preview to file.

remarks.para: The ExportPrintPreviewToFileTask Task requires EnterpriseAutomationEdition. If the BarTender version is not EnterpriseAutomationEdition or greater, this Task will not be allowed on the TaskQueue.
Use this task to export all labels for a print job. This task is useful for archiving or exporting images for display in an application or web page.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create and execute a ExportPrintPreviewToFileTask task to export a print preview.

Creates an
ExportPrintPreviewToFileTask instance, specifiying a LabelFormat to export.
member.param: The LabelFormat to print.
The directory to export the label preview files to.

The file name template used when saving the file. If "%PageNumber%" is included as part of the parameter, the page number is inserted at that location of the file name (i.e. "Preview%PageNumber%.jpg" results in "Preview1.jpg" for the first page).
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create an instance of the ExportPrintPreviewToFileTask class.

The resolution of exported image.
The color-depth of the exported image.
The background color of the exported image.

member.summary: Gets or sets the range of pages to export. A series of records can be specified with commas such as "1,2,4" and a range of pages can be specified with hyphens such as "1-3". member.summary: Creates a new Resolution instance that specifies width and height dimensions in pixels.

The exported label image will maintain its aspect ratio but will be sized to fit inside the specified pixel height and width.
Note: Use the AutoDimension constant for one of the arguments to have it automatically calculate the value needed to keep the correct aspect ratio while keeping the other dimension at the size requested. Only one argument of the two may be set to AutoDimension.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskEngine.Stop(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Stops the
TaskEngine and its underlying BarTender print engine.
member.param:
The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) an attempt will be made to successfully stop the TaskEngine. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.

If true, forces a busy TaskEngine to terminate regardless of whether or not the processing
Task is completed; false if otherwise. This only occurs once the timeout limit has been reached.
member.returns: A Result enumeration. Indicates whether the underlying BarTender print engine successfully stopped, failed to stop, or timed out.
member.remarks:
The Stop method does not guarantee immediate termination of a TaskEngine's background BarTender process. To ensure immediate termination of this process, use the
Terminate method instead.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to stop a TaskEngine instance.

members.member:
ASK SARA ABOUT THIS ONE.
Stops the
TaskEngine and starts it again.
The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) an attempt will be made to successfully stop the TaskEngine. If set to
System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite, the wait is infinite.
If true, forces a busy TaskEngine to terminate regardless of whether or not the processing
Task is completed; false if otherwise. This only occurs once the timeout limit has been reached.
A Result enumeration. Indicates whether the underlying BarTender print engine successfully stopped, failed to stop, or timed out.
The following example demonstrates how TaskEngine.Restart can be used to restart BarTender engines individually.

member.summary: Starts the BarTender print engine if stopped.

members.member:
ASK SARA ABOUT THIS ONE.
Starts the BarTender print engine if stopped.
The following example demonstrates how to start each TaskEngine inside a TaskEngines instance.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.PrintServer.TaskEngine.Terminate
member.summary:
Immediately stops the
TaskEngine instance.
Note: Any task that is currently processing is terminated whether it has completed or not.
member.remarks:
All
Task instances that are pending or currently processing are immediately aborted. When running a critical Task (such as a file save operation), this carries a high risk of data corruption. In these cases, use the
Stop method instead.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to terminate each idle TaskEngine inside a TaskEngines instance.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor
member.summary: Provides delegates and events used to monitor print jobs.
member.remarks:
When printing a label format via a networked printer, the Printer Maestro service MUST be installed on both the computer the networked printer is attached to and the local machine the client application is running on.
If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on a printer, no print job event monitoring will occur for print jobs on that printer. If the Printer Maestro service is not installed on the client computer, no print job event monitoring will occur for any print job sent from the client computer. In both cases, resulting print jobs will generate an
PrinterMonitorErrorOccurred event.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive a basic event from an instance of PrintJobMonitor.

member.name: M:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Bleh.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobCancelled
member.summary: Occurs when a print job is cancelled.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobCancelled event occurs when the print job in the spooler is cancelled. JobCancelled is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) cancelled from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobCancelled event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobErrorOccurred
member.summary: Occurs when a print job encounters an error.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobErrorOccurred event occurs when the print job in the spooler encounters an error. JobErrorOccurred is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) generating errors from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobErrorOccurred event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobPaused
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has paused.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobPaused event occurs when the print job in the spooler has paused. JobPaused is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) paused from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobPaused event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobResumed
member.summary: Occurs when a print job resumes printing after being paused.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobResumed occurs when the print job in the spooler has resumed. JobResumed is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) resumed from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobResumed event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobRestarted
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has restarted.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobRestarted event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobSent
member.summary: Occurs when the print job has been sent to the printer port. This event does not ensure that the print job has been printed.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The JobSent event occurs when the print job in the spooler has been sent. JobSent is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) sent from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobSent event.

member.name: E:Seagull.BarTender.Print.PrintJobMonitor.JobQueued
member.summary: Occurs when a print job has been spooled.
member.remarks: When any label format is opened by an Engine instance, various Windows spooler print job events may be monitored. The OnJobSpooledEvent occurs when the print job in the spooler has been spooled. OnJobSpooledEvent is called for all label formats (LabelFormatDocument) spooled from the Engine instance.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to receive JobQueued event.

member.summary:
Occurs when the
PrintJobMonitor ecounters an error.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormatDocument
member.summary: Represents a label format document that can be opened, saved, and printed in BarTender.
member.remarks: A LabelFormatDocument object represents a label format that is currently open or can be opened in a BarTender print engine. A label format file can be opened by calling Documents.Open with a running Engine. By contrast, the LabelFormat class represents information about a label format that may or may not happen to be open in BarTender, and does not represent the document itself.
member.example: The following example demonstrates opening, printing, and closing a LabelFormatDocument instance using an Engine.

member.name: T:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormat
member.summary: Represents a label format. LabelFormat objects hold the data and properties for a label that may or may not be open in BarTender.
member.remarks: To print a label using the properties set on a LabelFormat object, pass in the LabelFormat object when opening a LabelFormatDocument. When a LabelFormatDocument is opened in this way, any format data that was set on the LabelFormat object will carry over to the newly opened LabelFormatDocument. This allows format data to be set before the LabelFormatDocument is opened in a BarTender print engine.
member.example: The following example demonstrates how to create an instance of LabelFormat then open a LabelFormatDocument using an engine, then finally print the format.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormat.LabelStatus.Created
member.summary: The LabelFormat has been created but hasn't ever been opened by BarTender. This means that properties can be set to be written to an open format at a later time. member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormat.LabelStatus.Cached
member.summary: The LabelFormat has been opened in BarTender previously but is no longer open. The Format's properties have been cached so they can still be read. Properties can still be be written to and will be cached until the LabelFormat is used to open a LabelFormatDocument.

member.name: F:Seagull.BarTender.Print.LabelFormat.LabelStatus.Loaded
member.summary: The LabelFormat is currently open in BarTender. Reading and writing the Format's properties will directly interact with the format open in BarTender.
